titlestmt.title: Collection List for the Fitzwilliam Museum Blake Collection

Andrea Dickens

publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: ©2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

div1.head: Catalog Information
div1.p: "Bindman" refers by entry number to David Bindman, ed., William Blake: Catalogue of the Collection in the Fitzwilliam Museum Cambridge (Cambridge, England: W. Heffer and sons Ltd. For the Syndics of the Fitzwilliam Museum, 1970). Entry numbers 467 and higher appear in the Appendix to Bindman, pages 65-84, and correspond to the entry numbers in [Geoffrey Keynes], Bibliotheca Bibliographici: A Catalogue of the Library Formed by Geoffrey Keynes (London: The Trianon Press, 1964). Keynes bequeathed part of his Blake collection to the Fitzwilliam Museum in 1982. Some materials listed in the Bindman appendix representing the Keynes bequest have not (or at least not yet) been received by the Museum; other materials (e.g., The Marriage of Heaven and Hell copy E, no. 510 in Bibliotheca Bibliographici) that were received by the Museum are not listed in the Bindman appendix. Most of the books from the Keynes collection containing Blake's commercial book illustrations and listed in the Bindman appendix are in the Cambridge University Library. For a list of the Keynes bequest acquired by the Museum, see The Annual Reports of the Syndicate and of the Friends of the Fitzwilliam for the Year Ending 31 December 1985 (Cambridge: Fitzwilliam Museum, [1986]).
